sub_title: Management Consultant at ACE + Company | Sustainable Finance Regulatory Advisory | MSc in Environment and Resource Management | VU Amsterdam & ETH Zurich
summary:
🌱 Environmental studies graduated, with a background in economics & business. 
🌱 Passionate about changing economics and finance to benefit people and the environment. 
🌱 Devoting my professional energy to environmental consulting, value-driven banking, and ESG advisory. 

I have developed a strong interest in the global climate finance architecture through my past internships at ING and the Sustainability Strategy Team of my university. I am a fresh Master graduate, having recently submitted my thesis on the role and interpretation of global environmental consultancy firms of the resilience paradigm as applied in water-related projects. In my MSc Environment & Resource Management, I focused on the global sustainability challenges of the food system and on environmental governance issues at large. Last semester I have been pursuing my exchange semester at ETH Zurich, focusing on the energy transition, power markets and carbon mitigation technologies. Having studied at four universities across Europe equipped me with the necessary interpersonal skills to influence action through trust and communication.

‣ Maintained large excel databases on ESG loans and developments in the market.
‣ Prepared extensive pitch slide decks and bank lenders presentations for clients in various industries.
‣ Familiarised myself with EU Taxonomy Regulation, the Fit For 55 Package, the EU Sustainable Finance Strategy and diverse policies per sub-sector.

volunteer_experiences.description:
• Volunteered as a teacher of Romanian Language for refugees within the social-inclusion project Interact Plus;
• Offered integrated services for migrants, social dialogue and intercultural understanding.

An integral part of the Lions Clubs International (LCI), Leos have their own global network of over 6,500 Leo clubs in more than 140 nations. Leo clubs aim to empower young people to serve their communities, meet humanitarian needs, encourage peace and promote international understanding.

• 2013-14: Member; 2014-15: Project Director, 2015-16: Vice President; 2016-17: President.
• Coordinated and took part in all volunteering and fundraising projects, while building and strengthening a club membership of +35 members.
• Ensured that departments function properly and oversaw annual elections.
• Determined service needs in our local community and motivated my club's members to respond to them generously.
• Focused on social inclusion of members in projects that utilise their talents and interests.
• Employed effective resource management and increased the financial resources of the club through successful partnerships and fundraising events.
• Chaired multiple club meetings and worked closely with the sponsoring Lions Club "Moldova", the Leo Club Adviser and the Romanian 124 District.
• Attended the international Lions International Camp & Youth Exchange in Hamburg, Germany through which I fostered relationships with numerous people from different cultural backgrounds and developed important social skills.
